Docs.summary: Represents a configuration section in the element of the configuration file. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ScriptingJsonSerializationSection class enables you to programmatically access and modify the `jsonSerialization` element of the configuration section for using AJAX functionality in ASP.NET.
Use this type to set serialization and deserialization configuration values for AJAX-enabled applications.
## Examples The following configuration file excerpt shows how to declaratively specify values for properties of the ScriptingJsonSerializationSection class.
``` <system.web.extensions> <scripting> <webServices> <jsonSerialization maxJsonLength="1000" /> </webServices> </scripting> </system.web.extensions> ```
The following example demonstrates how to access ScriptingJsonSerializationSection programmatically.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of the MaxJsonLength property applies only to the internal <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer> instance that is used by the asynchronous communication layer to invoke Web services methods.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the limit for constraining the number of object levels to process.
Docs.value: The number of object levels. The default is 100.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The RecursionLimit property refers to the maximum level of an object hierarchy that <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer> will process when deserializing a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) string or when serializing an object.
The value of RecursionLimit applies only to the internal <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer> instance that is used by the asynchronous communication layer to invoke Web services methods.
